sentence: Why do accountants make good lovers? theyre great with figures.
explanation: In accounting, figures refer to numbers or data used for financial analysis.
first_new_sentence: The accountant analyzed the figures from last quarters sales.
second_new_sentence: The figures in the painting were artistically rendered.

sentence: How do you get the guitar player off of your porch? pay for the pizza.
explanation: In a financial context, paying refers to giving money in exchange for goods or services.
first_new_sentence: I need to pay the bills by the end of the month.
second_new_sentence: To pay attention means to listen carefully or be mindful.

sentence: What does a blonde say after having sex? are you all on the same team?
explanation: In sports or group contexts, a team refers to a group of players working together.
first_new_sentence: Our soccer team won the championship this year.
second_new_sentence: A team effort can often lead to better results than working individually.

sentence: I was going to tell a racist joke... but then my black friend stole them all.
explanation: To steal refers to taking someone elses property unlawfully.
first_new_sentence: He stole a glance at her beautiful dress.
second_new_sentence: The thief stole money from the bank.
